thread.title: The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley
thread.title_full: The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley

author: Justin Phillips
title: The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley
text:
The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley By Justin Phillips on January 13, 2017 at 4:24 PM Print The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley Owner Jen Pelka outside of the Riddler, a new Champagne bar in Hayes Valley. Photo: Liz Hafalia/The Chronicle 
The Riddler , Hayes Valley’s new champagne bar, officially opens Sunday , Jan. 15. 
The bar comes from first-time restaurateur Jen Pelka (Magnum PR) , and has a beverage menu with over 100 Champagnes. It’s also funded entirely by women. 
“We’re on schedule. All we’re doing now is the last minute stuff — final tastings and little, smaller tweaks on the space,” Pelka said. 
The Riddler’s concept is one that skews from chic-hip (they’ll serve caviar) to playfully relaxed (your Miller High Life could come in a champagne bucket). Sparkling wines will also be available starting at $10. 
The bar has very limited kitchen space so the food is going to be simple, but fun. Expect tater tot waffles, cheese, charcuterie, and desserts. Or just get the a food/drink hybrid order that comes with bumps of caviar and shots of champagne. The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley Caviar and shots of Miller High Life beer with chips at the Riddler. Photo: The Chronicle/Liz Hafalia The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley Serve yourself complimentary popcorn with 12 house made salt blends at the Riddler. Photo: Liz Hafalia/The Chronicle The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley Chocolate grand marnier Pots de Creme with chocolate pearls and Chartogne-Taillet Sainte Anne Brut Champagne at the Riddler. Photo: Liz Hafalia/The Chronicle The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley Beverage director Marissa Payne opens champagne at the Riddler. Photo: Liz Hafalia/The Chronicle The Riddler opens in Hayes Valley Caviar and shots of Miller High Life beer with chips at the Riddler. Photo: The Chronicle/Liz Hafalia preview0108_0024.JPG View of the outside of Riddler, a new Champagne bar in Hayes Valley. The painted bottle was designed by artist Danielle Moore. Photo: The Chronicle 
The Riddler: 528 Laguna St., at Linden, San Francisco; Opens Sunday. Normal hours will be Tuesdays through Thursdays and Sundays from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. and Fridays and Saturdays from 4 p.m. to 12 a.m.
